pros: Great place to work. Good people to work with
cons: No real cons at Clear Lake

job_title: Labor and Delivery Nurse in Webster, TX
pros: teamwork, patient population, coworkers, and great learning opportunities
cons: understaffed, overworked, terrible benefits, low pay

pros: Great benefits, nurses, and teamwork.
cons: Hourly rates are low. LOWEST paid hospital system. Upper management is more interested in getting their million-dollar bonuses and NOT paying the wages required to keep good nurses.

review_title: Would only work here as a last resort
pros: good benefits: tuition reimbursement, student loan repayment, PTO, health insurance, 401k match up to 3% of annual income
cons: Always short staffed, unsafe patient ratios, equipment always broken, pay is lower than other hospitals, "profit over patients" culture, management will ask you for your feedback and make empty promises

pros: Love my coworkers and my managers as people
cons: The organization only cares for itself

pros: Wonderful Experience. Well structured training program also.
cons: None that I can recall.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Houston, TX
pros: Loved the environment, was so happy working there. Great staff and great workers
cons: Will lay you off whenever times get tough

pros: My co-workers are amazing. Job stability. Benefits.
cons: Management does not care for staff. It's all about the money and how many patients they can cram into this place. Overall morale here is bad. Turnover rate is high. Not enough staff to safely care for patients.

review_title: Clear Lake promotes mediocrity and managment does not support its staff; there is no leadership at the hospital.
pros: The benefits are on par with other hospitals in the region. The heart hospital is a new facility with new equipment.
cons: Management does not enforce policy consistently with all staff; there is a high turnover rate in certain departments (as high as 85%) which, in turn, causes the staff to work longer hours with no relief, and more call days. Only certain staff members are called upon to consistently precept new staff; charge nurses leave the hospital for the day without  ensuring staffing is covered or call is covered; management  is told time and time again about issues within departments and they do nothing about it; the hospital promotes mediocrity- those who are lazy or do not possess the skills necessary to do their jobs well are allowed to continue being lazy and are not remediated. Those who work hard are often expected to pick up the slack by management. Management does not allow staff to realize their full potential through advancement even though it is merited; it is more of "who you know" rather than what you can bring to the table.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Webster, TX
pros: It’s a job you get a low paycheck move on
cons: Everything to say the least

review_title: Eh. Best way to decribe it.
pros: Corporate company, staff (RN, Nurse Tech, MD's) majority of them friendly and knowledgeable. Felt okay with calling other departments when unfamiliar with certain tasks/equipment.
cons: Corporate company, does not back up staff when it comes to patient 'satisfaction'. When needing help from administration/management, always felt left behind. So focused on the business aspect of the hospital, patient care and clinical staff are compromised. Staffing (which is always a problem, anywhere anytime), but not getting paid enough to do the job of 3 people. State they care about 'growth' but then selfish when actually wanting to make decisions. Benefits are not great.

review_title: lowest paying hospital with crappy benefits
job_title: Sterile Processing Tech in Clear Lake, TX
pros: free parking, you can call in or be late whenever you wanted because they don't bother to keep up with anything and feel free to destroy any equipment you wanted because they won't write you up.  It makes it hard to work there if you are a person who cares about your job and the patients
cons: the pay way below national average and will not even consider a raise, no matter how much education you have or how much you work.  Degrees and Certifications don't even matter to them

review_title: Nice facilty, but is very clickish
pros: This is a nice facilty inside and out. Senior management is reasonable. There seems to be supplies available most of the time when needed.
cons: lack of support from the staff is unsettling. Staffing can be short at times. Prepare to work through your lunch on a regular basis.

review_title: RN - worst experience of my life
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Webster, TX
pros: Decent pay in the beginning - but only to lure you in
cons: If you enjoy being bullied by other nurses then this is the place for you. Management communicates poorly, does not follow through.  They are so desperate to keep people that they will look the other way while employees constantly break policy and procedure and treat other people poorly.

review_title: Small Hospital feel and growing fast.
pros: This hospital is growing fast. It has a lot of new and beautiful facilities and always offering new services.
cons: Still has a small hospital mentality despite its growth and a lot of the new tech it offers. Example: many of the nurses in my department thought it was the end of the world simple because we were required to use Outlook email this year.

review_title: Mediocre. Pay sucks. Benefits could be better
pros: Free parking. Cafeteria discount for employees. Generous tuition reimbursement program.
cons:
The pay is substandard. Lowest paying hospital in the region. 
Benefits could be better
No shift differential for 3-7, and they are taking away bonus pay for working extra shifts.
Short staffed at ALL TIMES!

review_title: Management can destroy a good organization!
pros: Love working with my co-workers and patients and received compliments from the CNO
cons: Pay is lower than other hospitals. Bad manager and director, unfortunately they did not care about our concerns.

job_title: Nurse Manager in Clear Lake, TX
pros:
Very open and available leadership.
HCA hospital, provides vast opportunity to advance and transfer almost anywhere.
Consistent high performing hospital with excellent patient outcomes.
Center for cardiovascular excellence.
cons:
Employee parking.
Facility size, more walking than your average facility for a city of this size.
Older facility, seemingly always under construction.

pros: Making my schedule and getting a lot of vacation time approved. I enjoy my coworkers and love the layout of the hospital. Free parking and an easy drive!
cons: No tech and no help. Everything revolves around a “budget”. If I had a tech to help me I would give this hospital another star.

pros: Team work is amazing! Management listens to your needs.
cons: Pay, food in cafeteria, and staffing SUCKS! Nurse and nurse tech patient ratios too high!

review_title: Great environment to live and work, facilities and equipment are readily available...
pros: Facility itself is very well kept, treatment of staff from management is with respect and fair, self scheduling gives staff flexibility.
cons: Non competitive pay for telemetry compared to surrounding facilities, no room for growth or advancement from entry position, frequent changes to unit policies.

pros: CLRMC is a very comprehensive hospital. I worked in the human resources department so I wasn't always on the medical care side of things. I enjoyed my job. I had a lot of freedom and flexibility in my schedule.
cons: Personal relationships often got in the way of productive work.

pros: Pretty much everyone who works there is easy to work with. I worked there for 8 years with no major concerns.
cons: The compensation for my position was not good. I took a huge pay cut to work there due to convenience to my home.

review_title: Nurses and patients care sometimes get overlooked

pros: stable job, pay is fine, in spite of covid management has tried to keep us employed.
cons: processes sometimes come before people (nurses and patients)

pros: pay, location, opportunities in all departments, management willing to work with you on transferring if not happy in department or area
cons: understaffed, work load heavy, no breaks, management not concerned with employee complaints or concerns, long hours you never leave on time

pros: Close to home, free parking. Leadership development is good. Friendly people and staff at the bedside want to be there.
cons: High leadership turnover rate. Leadership support is marginal. Unrealistic expectations at times.

pros: Good organization with good benefits.  Great co-workers. Very team oriented.
cons: In order to achieve goals,I found that my work-life balance was sacrificed.
